SEARCH
Package grafioschtrader.repository

Interface GTNetJpaRepositoryCustom

All Superinterfaces:
BaseRepositoryCustom<GTNet>
All Known Subinterfaces:
GTNetJpaRepository
All Known Implementing Classes:
GTNetJpaRepositoryImpl
public interface GTNetJpaRepositoryCustom extends BaseRepositoryCustom<GTNet>
Custom repository interface for complex GTNet operations not covered by Spring Data JPA. Provides three main capabilities:
  • Combined data retrieval for UI display
  • Client-initiated message submission
  • Server-side message response processing (M2M endpoint)
See Also:
  • for implementation details

  • Method Details

    • saveOnlyAttributes

      GTNet saveOnlyAttributes(GTNet gtNet) throws Exception
      Updates a GTNet entity with selective attribute modifications. Only attributes marked with appropriate update annotations will be changed. When serverBusy status changes, automatically notifies all connected peers.
      Parameters:
      gtNet - the entity containing new values to save
      Returns:
      the updated GTNet entity
      Throws:
      Exception - if the save operation fails or validation errors occur

    • getAllGTNetsWithMessages

      GTNetWithMessages getAllGTNetsWithMessages()
      Retrieves all GTNet domains with their associated message history. Combines multiple queries into a single response for efficient UI rendering:
      • All GTNet entries (domains)
      • All messages grouped by domain ID
      • The local instance's GTNet ID (for highlighting)
      Returns:
      combined DTO for the GTNet setup screen

    • submitMsg

      GTNetWithMessages submitMsg(MsgRequest msgRequest)
      Submits a message from the UI to one or more remote domains. Handles the complete message submission workflow:
      1. Determines target domains (single or broadcast based on message code)
      2. Ensures handshake is complete for each target (creates if needed)
      3. Creates and saves the outgoing GTNetMessage
      4. Sends the message via BaseDataClient
      5. Saves any synchronous responses received
      Parameters:
      msgRequest - the message details from the UI
      Returns:
      updated GTNetWithMessages for UI refresh

    • getMsgResponse

      MessageEnvelope getMsgResponse(MessageEnvelope messageEnvelope) throws Exception
      Processes an incoming M2M message and generates an appropriate response. This is the server-side entry point for all incoming GTNet traffic. Dispatches based on message code to handle:
      • GT_NET_PING - Liveness checks
      • GT_NET_FIRST_HANDSHAKE_S - Initial token exchange
      • Other message codes - (TODO: implementation incomplete)
      Parameters:
      messageEnvelope - the incoming message
      Returns:
      response envelope to send back to the caller
      Throws:
      Exception - if message processing fails

    • validateIncomingToken

      void validateIncomingToken(String sourceDomain, String authToken)
      Validates the authentication token from an incoming M2M request. Compares the provided token against the tokenThis we generated and sent to the remote domain during handshake. If the tokens don't match or the domain is unknown, throws an exception that results in HTTP 401 Unauthorized.
      Parameters:
      sourceDomain - the domain URL from the incoming message
      authToken - the token from the Authorization header
      Throws:
      SecurityException - if the token is invalid or missing
